alert.note: Alert for Cascades in Lane County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 28 at 2:46AM PST until January 30 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 11 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...Cascades in Lane County. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 11 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. Subzero wind chills are expected for the Cascade passes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves. If driving through the Cascades this weekend, be sure to bring your winter weather preparedness kit, make sure your cell phone is charged, and have a full tank of gas.
